"A.P.242/2/15/15:00": "The A.I.S. researcher Sara told us about should be around here..."
"Hmmm, that's strange..."
"Oh, right right right!"
"Aagh that won't work, it'll screw up their endurance... Oh, but then I can just use that..."
"Bleagh! What's wrong? What happened?"
"Hello."
"Are you in charge of the A.I.S. project?"
"Hm? Hmmmmm? Ahhhh, I see! Good thing I asked!"
"Welcome, welcome! How do you do? I'm Ludmilla of the Research Division. It's great to finally meet you, Guardians."
"This is a bit sudden but I'd like to start the operation training and adjustments right away. We might need them at any time."
"H-Hold on, Ludmilla. What are you talking about?"
"What else? The A.I.S., of course."
"They left me in charge of revamping them. I've already got the basics bits put together. They'll even be able to fight in space."

"But either way, right now they're for emergency response. I'm still worried about some of the
all-purpose parts. That's why I need live data."
"So I asked General Affairs to send me the best of the best A.I.S. pilots for testing. Then, you two showed up."

"That leaves us with just one thing left to do.
Now, let's get a move on. Time waits for no man."
"They should function well regardless of the pilot, so maybe I should add some modules and make it easier to control."
"Would the average grunt be able to fight if I jack up the output? ...Their bodies probably wouldn't be able to handle it."
"Maybe if we fortified the cockpit safeguard? I've gotta run some calculations on what that'll cost."

"Live data... So we just have to move around?
...I'm not very comfortable piloting them."
"That's right. I've heard that <%me> made good use of the A.I.S. while fighting Apprentice."
"For ARKS, for the future, and most of all, for my research, I'm counting on you guys."
"...Well, if we're already here, we might as well help out. It's a favor for Sara, after all."
